Headline: London activists 'prepared to go to prison' to force action
Description: Group of campaigners arrested after spray painting mayor’s offices as part of a series of direct action protests over of the capital’s illegal air pollution

Headline: Climate change soon to cause mass movement, World Bank warns
Description: 140m people in three regions expected to migrate before 2050 unless environment is improved

Headline: Water shortages could affect 5bn people by 2050, UN report warns
Description: Conflict and civilisational threats likely unless action is taken to reduce the stress on rivers, lakes, aquifers, wetlands and reservoirs

Headline: Ban new petrol and diesel cars in 2030, not 2040, says thinktank

Headline: Is the way we think about overpopulation racist?

Description: Dana Nuccitelli: Let fossil fuel-funded think tanks make their case, then ignore it

Headline: Billion-dollar polar engineering ‘needed to slow melting glaciers’
Description: Underwater sea walls and artificial islands among projects urgently required to avoid devastation of global flooding, say scientists

Headline: UN moves towards recognising right to a healthy environment
Description: Formal recognition would help protect those who increasingly risk their lives to defend the land, water, forests and wildlife, says the UN special rapporteur on human rights and the environment

Headline: We must honour lost land defenders by fighting the system which killed them
Description: Sebastian Ordoñez Muñoz: Two more defenders in Latin America have lost their lives challenging their country’s economic growth model which prizes profit at all cost

Headline: Recording the deaths of environmental defenders around the world
Description: This year, in collaboration with Global Witness, the Guardian aims to record the deaths of all people killed while protecting land or natural resources. At the current rate, about four defenders will die this week somewhere on the planet

Headline: UN urges respect for environment activists after wildlife campaigner death

Headline: Bike safety consultation shows someone in government might understand cycling
Description: Amid plans for an unnecessary law change targeting cyclists, a parallel government consultation on safety makes some unexpectedly sensible points.

Headline: Stop blaming ‘both sides’ for America’s climate failures

Headline: Why what we eat is crucial to the climate change question
Description: Ruth Khasaya Oniang’o: Our food – from what we eat to how it is grown – accounts for more carbon emissions than transport and yet staple crops will be hit hard by global warming
